name: Least prime pn such that there is a set p1 < p2 < ... < pn of primes such that, for any distinct p and q in the set, (p + q)/2 is prime.
comment: Balog shows that a(n) exists for each n. E. Bombieri showed that a(12) <= 434717 with the set {5, 17, 521, 42281, 138461, 195137, 204137, 221537, 363497, 367001, 414737, 434717}.
link: Antal Balog, Linear equations in primes, Mathematika 39 (1992), no. 2, pp. 367-378.
example: Here are sets {p1, ..., pn} with pn minimal. Note that for n = 1..12, the set is unique.
author: _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 25 2025
